DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Frequency Ratio ISO21090.RTO.INT,PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that is an action whose immediate and primary intention is the alteration of the physical condition of the study subject or experimental unit. EXAMPLE(S): Procedures may involve the disruption of some body surface (e.g. an incision in a surgical procedure). Conservative procedures such as reduction of a luxated joint, including physiotherapy such as chiropractic treatment, massage, balneotherapy, acupuncture, shiatsu. A ratio representing the number of occurrences of an activity within a given time period. EXAMPLE(S): Once per 12 hours; 2 times per day

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Frequency Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Quantity quotient of a numerator of type INT divided by a denominator of type PQ.TIME.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
